title: [Massive] Japanese Video Game Localization Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: JLPT N3 or higher in Japanese, understanding of basic translation theory
context.additional_context: A collaborative learning environment emphasizing translation practice and feedback processes through simulation of an actual video game localization project

learning_goals: Learners can apply at least three translation strategies considering the context of Japanese video game dialogues (text) and UI elements.

Learners will produce 3 game translations adhering to constraints (≤15 characters, 3-second voice sync) and meet ≥4 of 5 quality verification checklist items (accuracy, technical suitability, creativity).
Learners can achieve a final translation quality of over 80% through iterative translation based on peer and instructor feedback.

resources: Game Development Team Collaboration Scenario Materials

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
